column34:
Domestic abuse affects millions of men world wide every year. WB DC HBO have perpetuated the silencing of men who suffer from domestic violence by supporting a reasonably proven domestic abuser. Amber Heard admitted in court documents that she abused Johnny Depp by psychological violence, recordings of her admitting to hitting, throwing objects, verbally harassing and gaslighting Johnny have been heard around the world. The time has come for the world to take a stand for equal domestic violence awareness. 

According to the CDC in the United States, "Intimate Partner Violence [affects] About 1 in 3 men experienced contact sexual violence, physical violence, and/or stalking by an intimate partner during their lifetime.
Nearly 56% of men who were victims of contact sexual violence, physical violence, and/or stalking by an intimate partner first experienced these or other forms of violence by that partner before age 25." https://www.cdc.gov/violenceprevention/intimatepartnerviolence/men-ipvsvandstalking.html

And in the UK "The Office for National Statistics figures show every year that one in the three victims of domestic abuse are male equating to 757,000 men.." https://www.mankind.org.uk/statistics/statistics-on-male-victims-of-domestic-abuse/

End the double standard! There is still a largely held denial that men can be victims of domestic abuse and WB DC HBO are continuing this dismissive view. If equal awareness for domestic abuse victims has to have a high profile case to garner public acceptance then let it start with Amber and Johnny. Documentation, comfirmed recordings and statements have been made public of Amber violently attacking Johnny, throwing multiple objects and glass bottles at him resulting in the required surgery to repair bone and nerve damage. Some will argue "it was only a finger tip" but those are the people that don't understand the mental trauma that results from violence like this. 

WB DC HBO, producer Peter Safran has made a statement that he does not care what the fans want and has tried silencing our voices. If our voices are unwanted than so too is our money. 

This is a public call to boycott WB DC HBO productions and services. Pledge to cancel all subscriptions and boycott productions. Fan voices matter. Male domestic violence victims matter.

Domestic abuse affects millions of men world wide every year. WB DC HBO have perpetuated the silencing of men who suffer from domestic violence by supporting a reasonably proven domestic abuser. Amber Heard admitted in court documents that she abused Johnny Depp by psychological violence, recordings of her admitting to hitting, throwing objects, verbally harassing and gaslighting Johnny have been heard around the world. The time has come for the world to take a stand for equal domestic violence awareness. 

According to the CDC in the United States, "Intimate Partner Violence [affects] About 1 in 3 men experienced contact sexual violence, physical violence, and/or stalking by an intimate partner during their lifetime.
Nearly 56% of men who were victims of contact sexual violence, physical violence, and/or stalking by an intimate partner first experienced these or other forms of violence by that partner before age 25." https://www.cdc.gov/violenceprevention/intimatepartnerviolence/men-ipvsvandstalking.html

And in the UK "The Office for National Statistics figures show every year that one in the three victims of domestic abuse are male equating to 757,000 men.." https://www.mankind.org.uk/statistics/statistics-on-male-victims-of-domestic-abuse/

End the double standard! There is still a largely held denial that men can be victims of domestic abuse and WB DC HBO are continuing this dismissive view. If equal awareness for domestic abuse victims has to have a high profile case to garner public acceptance then let it start with Amber and Johnny. Documentation, comfirmed recordings and statements have been made public of Amber violently attacking Johnny, throwing multiple objects and glass bottles at him resulting in the required surgery to repair bone and nerve damage. Some will argue "it was only a finger tip" but those are the people that don't understand the mental trauma that results from violence like this. 

WB DC HBO, producer Peter Safran has made a statement that he does not care what the fans want and has tried silencing our voices. If our voices are unwanted than so too is our money. 

This is a public call to boycott WB DC HBO productions and services. Pledge to cancel all subscriptions and boycott productions. Fan voices matter. Male domestic violence victims matter.

Sisters, don't let bastards take your life.
Anita Kanitz, trade unionist, publishing house bookseller

How is it possible that hatred of women – often well organized – is spreading on so many levels and worldwide? Much has already been said and written about the threatening anti-feminist backlash and the increasing sexism against women, which seems to be gradually becoming socially acceptable.
The register of attacks and threats to women who express themselves in public is long: it ranges from personal insults to female politicians in parliament (constant heckling and laughter when women speak there are unfortunately almost common in this country worldwide), to hate mail ( often sent under the real name!) and verbal attacks as well as sexual harassment in the protection of the anonymity of the network up to very specific persecution on the street.
The systematic hostility comes to a large extent from the right, but also from the religious. Behind them are men from all walks of life. The hodgepodge of anti-feminist "movements" ranges from "masculinists," who propagate the alleged downfall of men and their natural rights, to the so-called incels, who babble about their supposed right to intercourse, which women would deny them.
It doesn't matter who is behind hate and hate speech against women: According to the motto "constant dripping wears the stone" it's about making hostilities and sexism socially acceptable through repetition, silencing women, ousting them from hard-won positions, to subordinate them and make them invisible (e.g. by means of the discussion about gendering). The goal: maintaining power to protect the privileges that men have because they are men.
A drastic example shows us the supposedly so modern America in the past few weeks in the year 2022, in the 21st century.
Actress Amber Heard should not have described herself as a victim of domestic violence, the court ruled on June 1, 2022. A shocking verdict. However, the public annihilation of Johnny Depp's ex-wife has taken place before - on social media. Why the court's decision still has dramatic consequences for all women, girls, children and also men who are victims of male violence_
In 2022, Amber Heard is caught in the crossfire of public malice, a woman who publicly came out as a victim of abuse and was sued for defamation by her ex-husband Johnny Depp. Mind you, after the oddly universally admired Johnny Depp, a well-known alcoholic, drug addict, choleric, and misogynist (who can call his ex-girlfriends cunts, sluts, blackmailers and not face a libel suit)
in London in 2020 lost a libel case against the Sun and Amber Heard. Here he was clearly convicted and labeled a woman beater by the court.
 The new American witch trial, sorry, the so-called defamation trial was now unnecessarily tried in public, in frightening to repulsive details and with the hooting of the public online. Judge Penny Azcarate had inexplicably allowed two poolside cameras to be broadcast by the American cable network Court TV so the nation could watch live as hideous details of the deeply narcissistic physical, sexual and emotional abuse of a young woman by the court TV superstar and millionaire, were dragged into the public eye.
But it was Amber Heard who was stylized into pictures from the hall in Virginia on the Internet as a megara who was not in control of her own emotions and had nothing else in mind than destroying an idol. The pop singer Lance Bass recreated a statement by Amber Heard in a Tiktok video, the language app Duolingo made fun of Heard, and pet owners had their four-legged friends portray Amber. Snippets of their statements were taken out of context. The balance of power is clear: the hashtag #JusticeForAmberHeard has 53.3 million views on TikTok, the hashtag #JusticeForJohnnyDepp has 16.2 billion views - 300 times more. A frightening balance of the worldwide, digital misogyny, only one single narcissistic manipulative man was enough to trigger it with his fans, supporters.
Amber Heard was ordered to pay Depp $15 million while Depp was ordered to pay only $2 million. It has already become known that Heard is financially ruined and is appealing, but actually has no money for it. Petitions were stopped online that wanted to support her financially, no wonder in sight of this concentrated misogyny!
Can we now herald the end of Metoo?

column34:
Domestic abuse affects millions of men world wide every year. WB DC HBO have perpetuated the silencing of men who suffer from domestic violence by supporting a reasonably proven domestic abuser. Amber Heard admitted in court documents that she abused Johnny Depp by psychological violence, recordings of her admitting to hitting, throwing objects, verbally harassing and gaslighting Johnny have been heard around the world. The time has come for the world to take a stand for equal domestic violence awareness. 

According to the CDC in the United States, "Intimate Partner Violence [affects] About 1 in 3 men experienced contact sexual violence, physical violence, and/or stalking by an intimate partner during their lifetime.
Nearly 56% of men who were victims of contact sexual violence, physical violence, and/or stalking by an intimate partner first experienced these or other forms of violence by that partner before age 25." https://www.cdc.gov/violenceprevention/intimatepartnerviolence/men-ipvsvandstalking.html

And in the UK "The Office for National Statistics figures show every year that one in the three victims of domestic abuse are male equating to 757,000 men.." https://www.mankind.org.uk/statistics/statistics-on-male-victims-of-domestic-abuse/

End the double standard! There is still a largely held denial that men can be victims of domestic abuse and WB DC HBO are continuing this dismissive view. If equal awareness for domestic abuse victims has to have a high profile case to garner public acceptance then let it start with Amber and Johnny. Documentation, comfirmed recordings and statements have been made public of Amber violently attacking Johnny, throwing multiple objects and glass bottles at him resulting in the required surgery to repair bone and nerve damage. Some will argue "it was only a finger tip" but those are the people that don't understand the mental trauma that results from violence like this. 

WB DC HBO, producer Peter Safran has made a statement that he does not care what the fans want and has tried silencing our voices. If our voices are unwanted than so too is our money. 

This is a public call to boycott WB DC HBO productions and services. Pledge to cancel all subscriptions and boycott productions. Fan voices matter. Male domestic violence victims matter.

column34:
Domestic abuse affects millions of men world wide every year. WB DC HBO have perpetuated the silencing of men who suffer from domestic violence by supporting a reasonably proven domestic abuser. Amber Heard admitted in court documents that she abused Johnny Depp by psychological violence, recordings of her admitting to hitting, throwing objects, verbally harassing and gaslighting Johnny have been heard around the world. The time has come for the world to take a stand for equal domestic violence awareness. 

According to the CDC in the United States, "Intimate Partner Violence [affects] About 1 in 3 men experienced contact sexual violence, physical violence, and/or stalking by an intimate partner during their lifetime.
Nearly 56% of men who were victims of contact sexual violence, physical violence, and/or stalking by an intimate partner first experienced these or other forms of violence by that partner before age 25." https://www.cdc.gov/violenceprevention/intimatepartnerviolence/men-ipvsvandstalking.html

And in the UK "The Office for National Statistics figures show every year that one in the three victims of domestic abuse are male equating to 757,000 men.." https://www.mankind.org.uk/statistics/statistics-on-male-victims-of-domestic-abuse/

End the double standard! There is still a largely held denial that men can be victims of domestic abuse and WB DC HBO are continuing this dismissive view. If equal awareness for domestic abuse victims has to have a high profile case to garner public acceptance then let it start with Amber and Johnny. Documentation, comfirmed recordings and statements have been made public of Amber violently attacking Johnny, throwing multiple objects and glass bottles at him resulting in the required surgery to repair bone and nerve damage. Some will argue "it was only a finger tip" but those are the people that don't understand the mental trauma that results from violence like this. 

WB DC HBO, producer Peter Safran has made a statement that he does not care what the fans want and has tried silencing our voices. If our voices are unwanted than so too is our money. 

This is a public call to boycott WB DC HBO productions and services. Pledge to cancel all subscriptions and boycott productions. Fan voices matter. Male domestic violence victims matter.

WB DC HBO, producer Peter Safran has made a statement that he does not care what the fans want and has tried silencing our voices. If our voices are unwanted than so too is our money.

column34:
Domestic abuse affects millions of men world wide every year. WB DC HBO have perpetuated the silencing of men who suffer from domestic violence by supporting a reasonably proven domestic abuser. Amber Heard admitted in court documents that she abused Johnny Depp by psychological violence, recordings of her admitting to hitting, throwing objects, verbally harassing and gaslighting Johnny have been heard around the world. The time has come for the world to take a stand for equal domestic violence awareness. 

According to the CDC in the United States, "Intimate Partner Violence [affects] About 1 in 3 men experienced contact sexual violence, physical violence, and/or stalking by an intimate partner during their lifetime.
Nearly 56% of men who were victims of contact sexual violence, physical violence, and/or stalking by an intimate partner first experienced these or other forms of violence by that partner before age 25." https://www.cdc.gov/violenceprevention/intimatepartnerviolence/men-ipvsvandstalking.html

And in the UK "The Office for National Statistics figures show every year that one in the three victims of domestic abuse are male equating to 757,000 men.." https://www.mankind.org.uk/statistics/statistics-on-male-victims-of-domestic-abuse/

End the double standard! There is still a largely held denial that men can be victims of domestic abuse and WB DC HBO are continuing this dismissive view. If equal awareness for domestic abuse victims has to have a high profile case to garner public acceptance then let it start with Amber and Johnny. Documentation, comfirmed recordings and statements have been made public of Amber violently attacking Johnny, throwing multiple objects and glass bottles at him resulting in the required surgery to repair bone and nerve damage. Some will argue "it was only a finger tip" but those are the people that don't understand the mental trauma that results from violence like this. 

WB DC HBO, producer Peter Safran has made a statement that he does not care what the fans want and has tried silencing our voices. If our voices are unwanted than so too is our money. 

This is a public call to boycott WB DC HBO productions and services. Pledge to cancel all subscriptions and boycott productions. Fan voices matter. Male domestic violence victims matter.

column34:
Domestic abuse affects millions of men world wide every year. WB DC HBO have perpetuated the silencing of men who suffer from domestic violence by supporting a reasonably proven domestic abuser. Amber Heard admitted in court documents that she abused Johnny Depp by psychological violence, recordings of her admitting to hitting, throwing objects, verbally harassing and gaslighting Johnny have been heard around the world. The time has come for the world to take a stand for equal domestic violence awareness. 

According to the CDC in the United States, "Intimate Partner Violence [affects] About 1 in 3 men experienced contact sexual violence, physical violence, and/or stalking by an intimate partner during their lifetime.
Nearly 56% of men who were victims of contact sexual violence, physical violence, and/or stalking by an intimate partner first experienced these or other forms of violence by that partner before age 25." https://www.cdc.gov/violenceprevention/intimatepartnerviolence/men-ipvsvandstalking.html

And in the UK "The Office for National Statistics figures show every year that one in the three victims of domestic abuse are male equating to 757,000 men.." https://www.mankind.org.uk/statistics/statistics-on-male-victims-of-domestic-abuse/

End the double standard! There is still a largely held denial that men can be victims of domestic abuse and WB DC HBO are continuing this dismissive view. If equal awareness for domestic abuse victims has to have a high profile case to garner public acceptance then let it start with Amber and Johnny. Documentation, comfirmed recordings and statements have been made public of Amber violently attacking Johnny, throwing multiple objects and glass bottles at him resulting in the required surgery to repair bone and nerve damage. Some will argue "it was only a finger tip" but those are the people that don't understand the mental trauma that results from violence like this. 

WB DC HBO, producer Peter Safran has made a statement that he does not care what the fans want and has tried silencing our voices. If our voices are unwanted than so too is our money. 

This is a public call to boycott WB DC HBO productions and services. Pledge to cancel all subscriptions and boycott productions. Fan voices matter. Male domestic violence victims matter.
